group_1.textCenter: My father and mother passed away when@I was still small.
It happened during a trip to a local hot@spring...

group_1.narration: It was so much fun...@The springs were nice, we did some bowling,@and even went up a mountain in a cable car!
But on the way back,@there was an accident...
When we were almost home,@we got hit by a careless driver.
I was the only one who survived.@I was told later that my parents saved me...

group_1.textCenter: After that, I was handed off from@relative to relative with no end in sight.
One thing led to another,@and I eventually ended up there...

group_1.narration: The Azalea House was an orphanage.@There were many kids just like me.
At first, I was really scared...@But I hid my fear behind a smile.
I remember doing the same thing back when@I was being passed around by my relatives.
No matter what bad things they said@or did to me, I'd bear it with a smile...@I guess it's a bad habit of mine...
Losing my parents, how my relatives@treated me... It was all too much for me.@It felt like my heart was being crushed...

group_1.textCenter: Maybe I was forcing myself to smile@to keep myself from breaking down.
But the director took one look at my@face and immediately understood.
You needn't force yourself to smile like@that here. Smile when your heart does.

group_1.narration: Hearing that, I instantly burst into tears...
And just like that, I came to love@the director with all my heart!

group_1.textCenter: The Azalea House became my favorite place.
All my friends there had their own stories...
It was a place where we could@all understand each other!

group_1.narration: Then there was that one girl,@who always looked after everyone.
The girl who was like our older sister...@Konoha Shizumi.
